name: Victoria Peak
description: Mountain on Hong Kong island (elevation 1,181 feet) known for its skyline & waterfront views.

name: Hong Kong Disneyland
tagline: Iconic amusement park with themed lands
description: Famous theme park complex featuring 7 areas with rides, shows and welcoming costumed characters.

name: Tsim Sha Tsui
description: Tsim Sha Tsui is a shopping and nightlife district in Kowloon. Casual eateries and eclectic local shops are packed along neon-lit Nathan Road, while luxury malls line nearby Canton Road. The

name: Lantau Island
tagline: Lantau Peak & Tian Tan Buddha statue
description: Lantau Island, the largest of Hong Kong's islands, lies at the mouth of the Pearl River. Its mountainous interior includes 934m-high Lantau Peak, known for its sunrises, and the area can be traversed

name: Ocean Park Hong Kong
tagline: Theme park with rides & wild animals
description: Theme park with rollercoasters & water rides, a cable car & a marine park with animal enclosures.

name: Victoria Harbour
tagline: Busy harbor with nighttime light shows
description: Bustling harbor area with waterfront scenery & popular nighttime light & fireworks displays.

name: Central
tagline: Luxury malls & lively Lan Kwai Fong bars
description: Central is Hong Kong’s frenetic business and retail heart, crammed with skyscrapers, swanky malls and luxury hotels. Iconic Victoria Harbor is filled with ferries and traditional boats. The neighborhood

name: Tian Tan Buddha
description: 260 steps lead up to this immense Buddha made of bronze, with carved bell, museum and relics inside.

name: Peak Tram
tagline: Funicular railway up to Victoria Peak
description: Victorian-era train taking visitors to the highest peak on Hong Kong island for views of the city.

name: Ngong Ping 360
description: 25-minute cable-car ride to 'village' of tourist attractions and activities, shops and restaurants.

name: Avenue of Stars, Hong Kong
description: Promenade with handprints & plaques honoring Hong Kong film stars, plus a Bruce Lee statue.

name: Ngong Ping
description: Ngong Ping is a highland in the western part of Lantau Island, Hong Kong. It hosts Po Lin Monastery and Tian Tan Buddha amidst the hills which is about 34 m tall. There are several hills nearby

name: Mong Kok
tagline: Busy markets, street food & tea shops
description: Mong Kok is a buzzing maze of narrow streets, known for shopping. Stalls with clothes and knick-knacks cram the vast Ladies’ Market, plants and colorful blooms fill the Flower Market, while Fa

name: Lamma Island
tagline: Hung Shing Yeh Beach & indie boutiques
description: Lamma Island has a free-spirited, multicultural vibe and is home to hipsters and creative types. Indie boutiques, craft stores and mellow cafes line Yung Shue Wan Main Street. The island’s hiking

name: Po Lin Monastery
description: Colorful hillside monastery & site of the landmark, 34-m. bronze Tian Tan Buddha statue.

name: Cheung Chau
description: Scenic isle with old temples, sandy beaches & a coastal walking trail, plus seafood restaurants.

name: Peak Tower
description: The Peak Tower is a leisure and shopping complex located at Victoria Gap, near the summit of Victoria Peak on Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong. It also houses the upper terminal of the Peak Tram.

name: Repulse Bay
description: Repulse Bay is a bay in the southern part of Hong Kong Island, located in the Southern District, Hong Kong.

name: Madame Tussauds Hong Kong
description: Museum chain for life-size wax replicas of famous Americans & historic icons in themed galleries.

name: Sky100
description: Indoor observation deck on the 100th floor with high-tech telescopes, interactive exhibits & a cafe.

name: Wong Tai Sin Temple
tagline: Taoist temple devoted to a Chinese deity
description: Built with feng shui elements, this Taoist shrine to Wong Tai Sin is considered a source of luck.

name: Lan Kwai Fong
description: Historic district of narrow streets & alleys lined with restaurants, nightclubs & bars.

name: Central–Mid-Levels escalator
description: Hillside transportation system with 20 escalators & 3 inclined moving walkways (going up from 10am).

name: Clock Tower, Hong Kong
tagline: Historical site in a scenic environment
description: Sweeping bay views are offered from this iconic landmark, once the site of the Kowloon Station.

name: Stanley Market
description: Bustling, old-school street market with vendors selling apparel, crafts & souvenirs.

name: Hong Kong Museum of History
tagline: Exhibits on the region's long history
description: Large museum showcasing the history & culture of Hong Kong from prehistoric to modern times.

name: Adventureland
tagline: Disneyland section with a jungle theme
description: Large, jungle-themed area inside Disneyland with whimsical rides, shops & restaurants.

name: Hung Hom
description: Hung Hom is an area of Kowloon, in Hong Kong, administratively part of the Kowloon City District, with a portion west of the railway in the Yau Tsim Mong District. Hung Hom serves mainly residential

name: Frontierland
description: Western-themed attraction at Hong Kong Disneyland Resort featuring a popular roller coaster.

name: Hong Kong Wetland Park
description: Large wetland reserve with a visitor center featuring educational exhibits, a cafe & souvenir shop.

name: Hong Kong Park
tagline: Large, scenic park with an aviary
description: 8-hectare park with landscaped gardens & scenic ponds, plus a large aviary & historical buildings.

name: Chi Lin Nunnery
description: Sprawling complex of cedar Buddhist temples built in Tang dynasty style, with gardens & lotus ponds.

name: Ten Thousand Buddhas Monastery
tagline: Large Buddhist temple with many statues
description: A long flight of steep steps leads to this sizable, intricate Buddhist temple with lots of statues.

name: Dragon's Back
description: The Dragon's Back is a ridge in southeastern Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong, between Wan Cham Shan and Shek O Peak. It lies within the Shek O Country Park. In 2004 the Dragon's Back Trail was selected

name: Hong Kong Zoological and Botanical Gardens
description: Free-admission, old-school zoo with a variety of monkeys, apes & birds amid exotic plants & trees.

name: Kowloon Park
tagline: City park teeming with birds & gardens
description: Bustling park boasting gardens, playgrounds & wildlife habitats, plus a large outdoor pool.

name: Hong Kong Global Geopark
tagline: Large area with unique rock formations
description: Sizable park featuring 2 geological regions with distinct rock formations & educational exhibits.

name: Nan Lian Garden
description: Tang Dynasty–style Chinese garden with timber architecture & a teahouse in a tranquil locale.

name: SoHo, Hong Kong
tagline: Shopping, nightlife, art, and dim sum
description: The SoHo district in Hong Kong is an entertainment zone located in Central and bordering between Lan Kwai Fong and Sheung Wan, within Central. The name is derived from its location: South of Hollywood Road.

name: Golden Bauhinia Square
tagline: Waterfront square with a golden statue
description: Gathering place with a daily flag-raising ceremony, a symbolic golden flower statue & harbor views.

name: Hong Kong Space Museum
description: Waterside egg-shaped building with planetarium and Omnimax films, plus space and astronomy exhibits.

name: Kowloon Peninsula
description: The Kowloon Peninsula is a peninsula that forms the southern part of the main landmass in the territory of Hong Kong. The Kowloon Peninsula and the area of New Kowloon are collectively known

name: Wong Tai Sin, Hong Kong
tagline:
Wong Tai Sin is an area in Wong Tai Sin District, New Kowloon, Hong Kong. The area was named after the Wong Tai Sin Temple.
The area was previously known as Chuk Yuen or Chuk Un, prior to the

name: Jordan, Hong Kong
description: Jordan is an area in the Yau Tsim Mong District of Hong Kong. It is named after a road of the same name in the district.

name: Peng Chau
description: Peng Chau is a small island located off the north-eastern coast of Lantau Island, Hong Kong. It is known for its temples, its small island lifestyle and accessibility to fresh seafood.

name: Lion Rock
description: Lion Rock, or less formally Lion Rock Hill, is a mountain in Hong Kong. It is located between Kowloon Tong of Kowloon and Tai Wai of the New Territories, and is 495 metres high. The peak consists

name: Hong Kong Science Museum
description: Kid-friendly museum featuring many hands-on science & technology exhibits & live demonstrations.

name: Lantau Peak
description: Hong Kong's second-highest mountain summit, known for its sunrise views & giant Buddha statue.

name: Victoria Park
tagline: Green space for sports, swimming & play
description: Large park with areas for soccer, volleyball, roller skating & basketball, plus a pool & play area.

name: Tsing Ma Bridge
tagline: Huge suspension bridge for road & rail
description: Major bridge spanning over 1300m between Tsing Yi and Ma Wan islands with a visitor centre.
